title: Omicron Brings New Round of Foreboding for British Businesses
content: “None of it’s going to be good,” an economist warns as people are likely to retreat from some aspects of social life as Covid measures tighten.

title: In Texas, a Battle Over What Can Be Taught, and What Books Can Be Read
content: A new state law constricts teachers when it comes to race and history. And a politician is questioning why 850 titles are on library shelves. The result: “A lot of our teachers are petrified.”

title: U.K. Court Rules Julian Assange Can Be Extradited to U.S.
content: The WikiLeaks founder can still appeal the verdict, which would leave him facing espionage charges that could put him in prison for decades.

title: Turkey’s President Follows His Own Advice Even as Economy Slips
content: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is increasingly isolated as he clings to an economic prescription that few endorse but that he believes will bear results before elections.

title: Mexico Migrant Truck Crash Leaves 53 Dead
content: Dozens more were reported injured in the crash in southern Chiapas state, where many migrants regularly cross into Mexico from Central America.

title: Divide Over Debt Limit Shows Pragmatic Republicans Are Dwindling
content: Fearing backlash from the right, most in the party dug in against a bipartisan deal needed to stave off a federal default.

title: Senate Clears Last Major Hurdle to Raising Debt Ceiling
content: Ending a monthslong impasse, lawmakers from both parties approved legislation that would let Congress raise the debt ceiling by a simple majority vote.

title: Rift Between Senator and Son Shows the Challenge of Taxing the Ultrarich
content: A dispute between Ron Wyden, the Democratic Senate Finance Committee chairman, and his hedge fund-manager son illustrates how the merely rich help the fabulously rich resist tax increases.

title: Jussie Smollett Found Guilty of Reporting a Fake Hate Crime
content: Mr. Smollett was convicted of filing a false police report in 2019 claiming he had been the victim of a racist and homophobic attack. The jury deliberated for more than nine hours.

more_info.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Mark Guarino

title: Where the Despairing Log On, and Learn Ways to Die
content: It has the trappings of popular social media, a young audience and explicit content on suicide that other sites don’t allow. It is linked to a long line of lives cut short.

more_info.byline: By Megan Twohey and Gabriel J.X. Dance

title: Elon Musk’s Latest Innovation: Troll Philanthropy
content: Some very wealthy people give their money away in an attempt to burnish their reputations. Not the Tesla C.E.O.

title: Eric Adams Returns From Ghana, His Spirit Cleansed and To-Do List Full
content: Mr. Adams, the mayor-elect of New York City, embarked on a weeklong spiritual journey to Ghana, less than a month before assuming office.

title: 11 Million New Oysters in New York Harbor (But None for You to Eat)
content: The oysters, which act as nonstop water filters, were added to the Hudson River as part of an ongoing project to rehabilitate the polluted waterways around the city.

title: Not Home for the Holidays
content: Liberated by the loss of tradition over the last two years, some are forging their own celebrations — or skipping them altogether.

title: ‘I Would Give Anything to Hold Their Hands Again’
content: A husband and wife find a way to talk to their young sons about an unspeakable event.

title: How Is the U.S. Economy Doing?
content: Why do Americans say that the economy is awful but that they’re doing fine?

title: So You Lost the Election. We Had Nothing to Do With It.
content: Why is it that progressives are always blamed when moderates lose?

title: Cash Is Out. Crypto Is In. Can We Trust What’s Happening to Money?
content: It’s not just about the demise of coins and dollar bills. It’s also about society’s faith in the very idea of money.

title: Why Omicron Makes You Feel Numb Instead of Terrified
content: This horror movie has been playing for 21 months.

title: What Do You Say to the Sufferer?
content: An attempt to be present with a stranger in pain.

des_facet: On Consolation: Finding Solace in Dark Times (Book)

title: Independent Journalism Is at Risk. Here’s How to Save It.
content: It will take more than speeches — or indeed Nobel prizes — to save independent journalism.

more_info.byline: By Maria Ressa and Mark Thompson

title: Will Covid Evolve to Be Milder?
content: While we may care, the virus really doesn’t.

title: Don’t Let ‘Treeson’ Drive You Out of New York City
content: Not everyone can make it in New York.

title: I Cherish This Lifeline to My Parents
content: Al Hirschfeld’s drawings of Stephen Sondheim’s shows were a gift.

des_facet: Sunday in the Park with George (Play)

title: For the Elderly, Complacency Could Be a Killer
content: Whatever the Omicron variant may mean for the young, it’s already clear that it can be deadly for the old.

title: I Play Video Games With My 4-Year-Old, and That’s OK
content: Video games may not be harmless, but what are you going to do?

title: We Need Less Talk and More Action From Congress on Tech
content: Mosseri talks while Congress dithers.

org_facet: Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

title: Democrats’ Dangerous Appetite for Eating Their Own
content: The party’s infighting and pessimism are just what Republicans savor.

title: Why the Biden Presidency Feels Like Such a Disappointment
content: A theory of political time explains how he has become a prisoner of great expectations.

title: The Sublime Spectacle of Yoko Ono Disrupting the Beatles
content: In Peter Jackson’s “The Beatles: Get Back,” Ono is a performance artist at the height of her powers.

title: School District Investigates Claims of Longtime Sexual Misconduct by Teachers
content: Six teachers from Babylon High School have been placed on leave as the investigation continues and alumnae come forward with claims.

title: Fox News Replaces Christmas Tree That Went Up in Flames in Manhattan
content: The original 50-foot tree had been ceremonially lit days earlier during a broadcast. A man was charged with seven counts including arson.

title: Just in Time for Christmas: Knitwear Fit for a T. Rex
content: The Natural History Museum in London outfitted its animatronic Tyrannosaurus rex in a colorful Christmas sweater.

title: Biden Orders Federal Vehicles and Buildings to Use Renewable Energy by 2050
content: Under an executive order, the federal government would phase out the purchase of gasoline-powered vehicles, and its buildings would be powered by wind, solar or other clean energy.

title: Covid Malaise
content: Why do Americans say the economy is in rough shape? Because it is.

title: The Censoring of Peng Shuai
content: China’s decision to censor a star athlete has confronted the sports industry with a dilemma — speak out on her behalf or protect its financial interests in the country.

more_info.byline: By Sabrina Tavernise, Robert Jimison, Mooj Zadie, Rachel Quester, Luke Vander Ploeg, Alex Young, Lisa Chow, Patricia Willens, Marion Lozano, Corey Schreppel, Brad Fisher, Dan Powell and Chris Wood

title: Is the University of Austin Just a PR Stunt?
content: Can a new university fix academia’s problems? Or will it just create another ideological bubble?

org_facet: Foundation for Individual Rights in Education

title: Standing Ready in the Aftermath of Disaster
content: When wildfires and hurricanes affected communities, support networks jumped in for the food insecure.

org_facet: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund

title: The Pennsylvania Senate Candidate Running as the Anti-Dr. Oz
content: In the closely watched Pennsylvania Senate race, Val Arkoosh, a doctor in the Democratic primary, sees openings to raise her profile.

title: Appeals Court Rejects Trump’s Bid to Shield Material From Jan. 6 Inquiry
content: A three-judge panel held that Congress’s oversight powers, backed by President Biden’s decision not to invoke executive privilege over the material, outweighed Mr. Trump’s residual secrecy powers.

title: Earth Is Getting a ‘Black Box’ to Hold Humans Accountable for Climate Change
content: When a plane crashes, its flight recorder is critical to piecing together the missteps that led to calamity. Now the planet is getting its own in case it self-destructs.

title: New York City Gives 800,000 Noncitizens Right to Vote in Local Elections
content: The legislation approved by the City Council will set up a system for legal residents to vote in municipal elections.

more_info.byline: By Jeffery C. Mays and Annie Correal

title: Citizen Enforcement of Abortion Law Violates Texas Constitution, Judge Rules
content: A state judge said the approach inappropriately granted standing and denied due process. Abortion providers said they would expand services if the State Supreme Court upheld the ruling.

title: House Approves Post-Trump Curbs on Presidential Power
content: Republicans almost unanimously opposed the Protecting Our Democracy Act, which might be broken into separate components in the Senate.

title: Demaryius Thomas, Ex-Denver Bronco, Is Found Dead
content: Mr. Thomas, 33, played as a wide receiver in the National Football League for 10 seasons and helped lead the Broncos to victory in the Super Bowl in 2016. He retired in June.

title: As Muratov Accepts Nobel, Legacy of His Russian Predecessors Recedes
content: Dmitri A. Muratov is only the third Russian to win the Nobel Peace Prize, after Andrei D. Sakharov and Mikhail S. Gorbachev. The openness they championed is under assault.

des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

title: Former D.E.A. Agent Sentenced to 12 Years in Drug Money Scheme
content: Jose Ismael Irizarry took part in a seven-year scheme that used proceeds from drug investigations to buy jewelry, cars and a house in Colombia, prosecutors said.

title: Indonesian Militant Sentenced to Life in Prison Over 2005 Bombing
content: A court said Upik Lawanga made bombs for an attack that killed 22 people at a market. He is a member of a terrorist group that bombed churches, hotels and a Bali nightclub in the 2000s.

title: U.S. Announces End to Combat Mission in Iraq, but Troops Will Not Leave
content: The U.S. military said it had transitioned to an advise and assist mission in the country, but the roughly 2,500 service members on the ground will remain, staying on in support roles.

des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces
org_facet: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

title: A Penny for Your Squats?
content: Among 52 incentives to exercise, giving people a 9-cent award if they returned to the gym after missing a workout helped the most.

title: The Health Toll of Poor Sleep
content: Finding that slumber sweet spot can be helpful for fending off a range of mental and bodily ills.

title: The Quiet Brain of the Athlete
content: The brains of fit, young athletes dial down extraneous noise and attend to important sounds better than those of other young people.

title: A Cold Plunge For a Mental Boost
content: A swimming collective in the United Kingdom seeks comfort in cold waters.

title: On Wintry Runs, Finding a Room of My Own
content: When I go running in slush and snow, ideas can break loose and float to the surface like little ice floes.

title: The Year on the Red Carpet
content: All that pent-up dressing up finally found an outlet. If it wasn’t a carpet per se, it was a public moment.

title: A Designer Who Lives With ‘Pickled’ Balloons and a Jellyfish-Shaped Lamp
content: Bethan Laura Wood has made her name dreaming up transportive rainbow-hued furniture and housewares. Her own London home is just as fantastical.

title: ‘Red Rocket’ Review: All My XXX’s Live in Texas
content: A porn star returns to his hometown in Sean Baker’s latest slice of hard-luck Americana.

title: Kim Abeles Turns the Climate Crisis Into Eco-art
content: She doesn’t just make art about pollution, she makes art out of it. Now her “Smog Collectors” series is on view at California State University, Fullerton.

title: Five Holiday Movies to Stream
content: A list of quality holiday movies on streaming services other than Netflix.
